intro: Kali jacquemontii, commonly known as the golden mustache plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy yellow bracts that resemble a mustache, hence its common name. It produces small, pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Kali jacquemontii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
